title: A CPython Eating Its Own Tail
description:
This is an expert-level talk that dives into CPython and discusses
various ways to embed Python interpreters. It starts with the "very high
level" embedding & the "pure" embedding, shows a fairly novel "zero
interpreter" embedding using Cython, a few attempts at a ctypes/cffi
embedding, and builds to a finish with a source-filter embedding of a
Python interpreter into itself. 

The purpose of this talk is to have some fun diving into CPython
internals while looking practical approaches to embedding CPython
interpreters into other (C/C++) processes. The final result, a Python 3
interpreter embedded into a Python 2 interpreter as an extension model,
is novel but may be of fairly limited actual use. It is, however, pretty
wild and a lot of fun!
